title: ‘Thursday Night Football’: How to Watch the Houston Texans vs. New York Jets Online Without Cable
description: The NFL gets ready for the start of the football week with the “Thursday Night Football” game. For Week 9, two AFC division rivals go head-to-head with the Houston Texans (6-2) facing off against the New York Jets (2-6) at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Thursday, Oct. 31. The game kickoffs at […]
author: Rudie Obias
excerpt: 'Thursday Night Football' kicks on Thursday, Oct. 31 with the Houston Texans vs. New York Jets: Here's where to find and watch the game online.
text: If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission. The NFL gets ready for the start of the football week with the “Thursday Night Football” game. For Week 9, two AFC division rivals go head-to-head with the Houston Texans (6-2) facing off against the New York Jets (2-6) at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Thursday, Oct. 31. The game kickoffs at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:15 p.m. PT. The NFL game livestreams on Prime Video. However, it’s not broadcasting on any network like NBC, ABC, CBS, Fox, ESPN or NFL Network, so the best way to watch it is online with a Prime Video membership. Popular on Variety Not a member? Sign up for a 30-day free trial to take advantage of all that Amazon Prime has to offer, including access to Prime Video and Prime Gaming; fast free shipping in less than two days with Prime Delivery; in-store discounts at Whole Foods Market, access to exclusive shopping events — like Prime Day and Black Friday — and more. You can purchase the livestream feed of the game starting at $8.99/Month for the standalone Prime Video plan, or $139.99/Year when you sign up for an annual Amazon Prime subscription here. Aside from “Thursday Night Football,” Prime Video is the home to other sports leagues, including the WNBA, NWSL, One Championship (MMA), Premier Boxing Champions, Overtime Elite (youth basketball) and more. It’s also where you can find hit movies and TV shows, such as “The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power,” “Batman: Caped Crusader,” “Mr. and Mrs. Smith,” “The Boys,” “Invincible,” “Reacher,” “Road House,” “Fallout,” “The Wheel of Time” and others. Starting at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:15 p.m. PT, “Thursday Night Football:” Houston Texans vs. New York Jets livestreams exclusively on Prime Video. The game is not broadcasting on any other network. The best way to watch the Texans-Jets game is with a subscription to Prime Video.
html:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

The NFL gets ready for the start of the football week with the “Thursday Night Football” game.

For Week 9, two AFC division rivals go head-to-head with the Houston Texans (6-2) facing off against the New York Jets (2-6) at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Thursday, Oct. 31. The game kickoffs at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:15 p.m. PT.

The NFL game livestreams on Prime Video. However, it’s not broadcasting on any network like NBC, ABC, CBS, Fox, ESPN or NFL Network, so the best way to watch it is online with a Prime Video membership.

Popular on Variety

Not a member? Sign up for a 30-day free trial to take advantage of all that Amazon Prime has to offer, including access to Prime Video and Prime Gaming; fast free shipping in less than two days with Prime Delivery; in-store discounts at Whole Foods Market, access to exclusive shopping events — like Prime Day and Black Friday — and more.

You can purchase the livestream feed of the game starting at $8.99/Month for the standalone Prime Video plan, or $139.99/Year when you sign up for an annual Amazon Prime subscription here.

Aside from “Thursday Night Football,” Prime Video is the home to other sports leagues, including the WNBA, NWSL, One Championship (MMA), Premier Boxing Champions, Overtime Elite (youth basketball) and more. It’s also where you can find hit movies and TV shows, such as “The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power,” “Batman: Caped Crusader,” “Mr. and Mrs. Smith,” “The Boys,” “Invincible,” “Reacher,” “Road House,” “Fallout,” “The Wheel of Time” and others.

Starting at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:15 p.m. PT, “Thursday Night Football:” Houston Texans vs. New York Jets livestreams exclusively on Prime Video.

The game is not broadcasting on any other network. The best way to watch the Texans-Jets game is with a subscription to Prime Video.
